üìö ClaseB1
Notas Generales
Objetivo

Lograr que los estudiantes pasen con √©xito todas las habilidades y demuestren que tienen los conocimientos necesarios que se requieren para ser certificados como un hablante de ingl√©s en nivel A1

¬øHasta d√≥nde se evalua en esta prueba?

Esta semana se estudia desde el m√≥dulo AQU√ç INICIAS EL NIVEL A2 hasta el m√≥dulo Semana 18: A2 TESTS PARA APROBAR EL NIVEL A2

Notas profesor

Este es el formato que el docente debe llenar https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1M6ymm7p4ZyLHwivDCiutwZ9XufRZbJIzYYVEzYUS3Yw/edit?gid=0#gid=0

Saludos

Los saludos deben ser reales. Un estudiante dice un saludo a otro compa√±ero y este debe darle una respuesta.

Saludos B√°sicos

Palabra

Traducci√≥n

Frase Ejemplo

Traducci√≥n Frase Ejemplo

Hi

Hola

Hi! How are you?

¬°Hola! ¬øC√≥mo est√°s?

Hello

Hola

Hello, nice to meet you!

¬°Hola, un placer conocerte!

Good morning

Buenos d√≠as

Good morning, everyone!

¬°Buenos d√≠as a todos!

Good afternoon

Buenas tardes

Good afternoon, sir.

Buenas tardes, se√±or.

Good evening

Buenas noches

Good evening, how was your day?

Buenas noches, ¬øc√≥mo estuvo tu d√≠a?

Hey

Hola (informal)

Hey, what‚Äôs up?

¬°Hola! ¬øQu√© pasa?

What‚Äôs up?

¬øQu√© tal?

What‚Äôs up, buddy?

¬øQu√© tal, amigo?

How are you?

¬øC√≥mo est√°s?

How are you today?

¬øC√≥mo est√°s hoy?

How‚Äôs it going?

¬øC√≥mo va todo?

How‚Äôs it going at work?

¬øC√≥mo va todo en el trabajo?

How do you do?

¬øC√≥mo est√° usted?

How do you do, Mr. Smith?

¬øC√≥mo est√°, Sr. Smith?
Saludos Intermedios

How have you been?

¬øC√≥mo has estado?

How have you been lately?

¬øC√≥mo has estado √∫ltimamente?

Long time no see

¬°Cu√°nto tiempo!

Long time no see, my friend!

¬°Cu√°nto tiempo, amigo!

Nice to see you

Gusto en verte

Nice to see you again!

¬°Gusto en verte de nuevo!

It‚Äôs been a while

Ha pasado tiempo

It‚Äôs been a while since we met.

Ha pasado tiempo desde que nos vimos.

How‚Äôs everything?

¬øC√≥mo va todo?

How‚Äôs everything at home?

¬øC√≥mo va todo en casa?

How‚Äôs your day?

¬øC√≥mo ha sido tu d√≠a?

How‚Äôs your day so far?

¬øC√≥mo ha sido tu d√≠a hasta ahora?

What‚Äôs new?

¬øQu√© hay de nuevo?

What‚Äôs new with you?

¬øQu√© hay de nuevo contigo?

How‚Äôs life?

¬øC√≥mo va la vida?

How‚Äôs life treating you?

¬øC√≥mo te trata la vida?

How‚Äôs work?

¬øC√≥mo va el trabajo?

How‚Äôs work these days?

¬øC√≥mo va el trabajo estos d√≠as?

How‚Äôs your family?

¬øC√≥mo est√° tu familia?

How‚Äôs your family doing?

¬øC√≥mo est√° tu familia?
Saludos Avanzados

Greetings

Saludos

Greetings, colleagues!

¬°Saludos, colegas!

Pleasure to meet you

Un placer conocerte

Pleasure to meet you in person!

¬°Un placer conocerte en persona!

What have you been up to?

¬øEn qu√© has estado?

What have you been up to lately?

¬øEn qu√© has estado √∫ltimamente?

How‚Äôs your week going?

¬øC√≥mo va tu semana?

How‚Äôs your week going so far?

¬øC√≥mo va tu semana hasta ahora?

It‚Äôs a pleasure to see you again

Es un placer verte de nuevo

It‚Äôs a pleasure to see you again after so long.

Es un placer verte de nuevo despu√©s de tanto tiempo.
B1 Evaluaci√≥n Vocabulario
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor?
  1. Muestra una lectura al estudiante y est√© debe traducir lo que dice ese texto. Obs: Si el estudiante no puede interpretar lo que est√° leyendo, debe decir el significado de las palabras. Las palabras en negrita dentro de los textos indican palabras claves que tuvieron un refuerzo especial en la plataforma
  2. Tambi√©n debe hacer la prueba del ANKI: Cada estudiante abre su ANKI y va diciendo el significado de cada una de las tarjetas. Debe hacer un m√≠nimo de 10 tarjetas en 1 minutos
Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante?

Ser capaz de reconocer el significado de la palabra

Lecturas para evaluar el vocabulario
Evaluaci√≥n 1 Vocabulario Nivel B1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version):

When I was ten, I wanted to make something special. I thought, ‚ÄúWhat can I do? I like animals.‚Äù That was the time I decided to build a small shelter. I had no money, just an idea and a dream. I asked my brother to help him clean the garden. He didn‚Äôt know why, but he said yes.

We had to take boxes and wood from the garage. Many people don‚Äôt go into old places, but we were excited. That year, the winter was cold, and I wanted to help. I said, ‚ÄúKeep your gloves on! It‚Äôs not safe.‚Äù He smiled. We found some tools and started working. I thought we could build something warm for stray cats and keep them safe.

On Sunday, we worked together. I felt happy to see our project grow. We painted it and added a roof. The other kids helped too. I was proud, more than ever before. Then my mom came outside. ‚ÄúWow! You did this?‚Äù she asked. I said, ‚ÄúYes, and now we want to help more animals.‚Äù

She took a look and said it was not only cute, but useful too. She asked if more kids would come and help again. I hoped so. The shelter had its own style and color. I put a note over the door: ‚ÄúSafe place for all.‚Äù

I think helping others is the best feeling. My mom also gave us hot chocolate and snacks. We sat back and smiled. After that day, we wanted to use our free time to build two more shelters. We learned how to do things with our hands and heart.

That was our best family project. We had to work hard, but it felt right. The first shelter helped a kitten that was sick. We cared for it and it got well again. Helping animals is a way to grow kindness. Even now, I remember that feeling.

It taught me to create new things, and to always want to help, because small actions can change lives. I don‚Äôt need any reward. I only need to see the animals happy.

These shelters became more than boxes. They give safety, and hope. That day, we started something real. The most special part was doing it together. It helped us understand that kindness is powerful.

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version):

When (1) I was ten, I wanted to make (2) something special. I thought, ‚ÄúWhat can (3) I do? I like (4) animals.‚Äù That was the time (5) I decided to build a small shelter. I had no (6) money, just (7) an idea and a dream. I asked my brother to help him (8) clean the garden. He didn‚Äôt know (9) why, but he said yes.

We had to take (10) boxes and wood from the garage. Many people (11) don‚Äôt go into (12) old places, but we were excited. That year (13), the winter was cold, and I wanted to help. I said, ‚ÄúKeep your (14) gloves on! It‚Äôs not safe.‚Äù He smiled. We found some (15) tools and started working. I thought we could (16) build something warm for stray cats and keep them (17) safe.

On Sunday, we worked together. I felt happy to see (18) our project grow. We painted it and added a roof. The other (19) kids helped too. I was proud, more than (20) ever before. Then (21) my mom came outside. ‚ÄúWow! You did this?‚Äù she asked. I said, ‚ÄúYes, and now (22) we want to help more animals.‚Äù

She took a look (23) and said it was not only (24) cute, but useful too. She asked if more kids would come (25) and help again. I hoped so. The shelter had its (26) own style and color. I put a note over (27) the door: ‚ÄúSafe place for all.‚Äù

I think (28) helping others is the best feeling. My mom also (29) gave us hot chocolate and snacks. We sat back (30) and smiled. After (31) that day, we wanted to use (32) our free time to build two (33) more shelters. We learned how (34) to do things with our hands and heart.

That was our (35) best family project. We had to work (36) hard, but it felt right. The first (37) shelter helped a kitten that was sick. We cared for it and it got well (38) again. Helping animals is a way (39) to grow kindness. Even (40) now, I remember that feeling.

It taught me to create new (41) things, and to always want (42) to help, because (43) small actions can change lives. I don‚Äôt need any (44) reward. I only need to see the animals happy.

These (45) shelters became more than boxes. They give (46) safety, and hope. That day (47), we started something real. The most (48) special part was doing it together. It helped us (49) understand that kindness is powerful.

Evaluaci√≥n 2 Vocabulario Nivel B1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version): 2

When I was ten, I wanted to make something special. I thought, ‚ÄúWhat can I do? I like animals.‚Äù That was the time I decided to build a small shelter. I had no money, just an idea and a dream. I asked my brother to help him clean the garden. He didn‚Äôt know why, but he said yes.

We had to take boxes and wood from the garage. Many people don‚Äôt go into old places, but we were excited. That year, the winter was cold, and I wanted to help. I said, ‚ÄúKeep your gloves on! It‚Äôs not safe.‚Äù He smiled. We found some tools and started working. I thought we could build something warm for stray cats and keep them safe.

On Sunday, we worked together. I felt happy to see our project grow. We painted it and added a roof. The other kids helped too. I was proud, more than ever before. Then my mom came outside. ‚ÄúWow! You did this?‚Äù she asked. I said, ‚ÄúYes, and now we want to help more animals.‚Äù

She took a look and said it was not only cute, but useful too. She asked if more kids would come and help again. I hoped so. The shelter had its own style and color. I put a note over the door: ‚ÄúSafe place for all.‚Äù

I think helping others is the best feeling. My mom also gave us hot chocolate and snacks. We sat back and smiled. After that day, we wanted to use our free time to build two more shelters. We learned how to do things with our hands and heart.

That was our best family project. We had to work hard, but it felt right. The first shelter helped a kitten that was sick. We cared for it and it got well again. Helping animals is a way to grow kindness. Even now, I remember that feeling.

It taught me to create new things, and to always want to help, because small actions can change lives. I don‚Äôt need any reward. I only need to see the animals happy.

These shelters became more than boxes. They give safety, and hope. That day, we started something real. The most special part was doing it together. It helped us understand that kindness is powerful.

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version): 2

When (1) I was ten, I wanted to make (2) something special. I thought, ‚ÄúWhat can (3) I do? I like (4) animals.‚Äù That was the time (5) I decided to build a small shelter. I had no (6) money, just (7) an idea and a dream. I asked my brother to help him (8) clean the garden. He didn‚Äôt know (9) why, but he said yes.

We had to take (10) boxes and wood from the garage. Many people (11) don‚Äôt go into (12) old places, but we were excited. That year (13), the winter was cold, and I wanted to help. I said, ‚ÄúKeep your (14) gloves on! It‚Äôs not safe.‚Äù He smiled. We found some (15) tools and started working. I thought we could (16) build something warm for stray cats and keep them (17) safe.

On Sunday, we worked together. I felt happy to see (18) our project grow. We painted it and added a roof. The other (19) kids helped too. I was proud, more than (20) ever before. Then (21) my mom came outside. ‚ÄúWow! You did this?‚Äù she asked. I said, ‚ÄúYes, and now (22) we want to help more animals.‚Äù

She took a look (23) and said it was not only (24) cute, but useful too. She asked if more kids would come (25) and help again. I hoped so. The shelter had its (26) own style and color. I put a note over (27) the door: ‚ÄúSafe place for all.‚Äù

I think (28) helping others is the best feeling. My mom also (29) gave us hot chocolate and snacks. We sat back (30) and smiled. After (31) that day, we wanted to use (32) our free time to build two (33) more shelters. We learned how (34) to do things with our hands and heart.

That was our (35) best family project. We had to work (36) hard, but it felt right. The first (37) shelter helped a kitten that was sick. We cared for it and it got well (38) again. Helping animals is a way (39) to grow kindness. Even (40) now, I remember that feeling.

It taught me to create new (41) things, and to always want (42) to help, because (43) small actions can change lives. I don‚Äôt need any (44) reward. I only need to see the animals happy.

These (45) shelters became more than boxes. They give (46) safety, and hope. That day (47), we started something real. The most (48) special part was doing it together. It helped us (49) understand that kindness is powerful.

Evaluaci√≥n 3 Vocabulario Nivel B1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version): 3

There was a very young girl who loved her family a lot. She was such a happy child even when things were down. She may not have had much money, but she should never give up.

One day, she heard a call from the world outside her village. She went to school, but she was still curious about what was through the big forest near her home.

She wanted to live a full life, so she decided to try something new. The last day of school, she asked her teacher if she could explore. She knew she need to be careful, but she felt ready.

There were three paths in the forest, and she didn‚Äôt know when she would return. The state of her mind was calm, even though she had never been so far from home.

She wanted to become brave. The forest was a place between her village and the unknown. The trees were high, and it was really beautiful.

She found something special ‚Äî a most amazing flower. She picked another one for her mother. She loved her family and wanted to have her own garden like this someday.

After walking out of the forest, she did not want to leave that feeling behind. She carefully put the flowers in her bag. The old forest had taught her a lesson.

While she was walking back, she thought about what the flowers mean. She promised to keep exploring as a student of life. She wondered why some people never try new things.

She decided to let her heart lead her. It was a great feeling to find the same courage others looked for in big adventures. The forest was a big part of her story now.

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version): 3

There was (1) a very young girl who loved (2) her family a lot. She was such (3) a happy child (4) even when things were down (5). She may (6) not have had much money, but she should (7) never give up.

One day, she heard a call (8) from the world (9) outside her village. She went to school (10), but she was still (11) curious about what was through (12) the big forest near her home.

She wanted to live a full life (13), so she decided to try (14) something new. The last (15) day of school, she asked (16) her teacher if she could explore. She knew she need (17) to be careful, but she felt (18) ready.

There were three (19) paths in the forest, and she didn‚Äôt know when (20) she would return. The state (21) of her mind was calm, even though she had never (22) been so far from home.

She wanted to become (23) brave. The forest was a place between (24) her village and the unknown. The trees were high (25), and it was really (26) beautiful.

She found something (27) special ‚Äî a most (28) amazing flower. She picked another (29) one for her mother. She loved her family (30) and wanted to have her own (31) garden like this someday.

After walking out (32) of the forest, she did not want to leave (33) that feeling behind. She carefully put (34) the flowers in her bag. The old (35) forest had taught her a lesson.

While (36) she was walking back, she thought about what the flowers mean (37). She promised to keep (38) exploring as a student (39) of life. She wondered why (40) some people never try new things.

She decided to let (41) her heart lead her. It was a great (42) feeling to find the same (43) courage others looked for in big adventures. The forest was a big (44) part of her story now.

Evaluaci√≥n 4 Vocabulario Nivel B1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version): 4

One day, Mr Carter needed help to talk with his team about a project where they had to turn ideas into solutions. The problem was that every person wanted to start work at the same time. He raised his hand and said this might be difficult.

He was an American manager and wanted to show his team that each part of the project was important. They talked about how to work against delays. They looked for a place quiet over there. It was such a busy schedule that they had to begin again a few times.

They hired a few extra developers in case the deadline was near. The most important task each week was to update the company leaders about progress. Then they wondered where the project‚Äôs system would fail. Mr Carter reminded each member to do the right thing.

They tested the program until they could hear feedback, so they could improve. One question came during the demo about compatibility. Some thought the software would work for education, others saw it as a way to play games. The government might use it too.

They needed to run tests on a small number of devices. They turned it off when a glitch appeared. They always had to move quickly to fix errors. It felt like they were working at night, but they wanted to live by their goals.

Mr Carter made his point clearly, and all team members believe in him. He will hold a meeting today to bring everyone together.

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version): 4

One day, Mr (1) Carter needed help (2) to talk (3) with his team about a project where (4) they had to turn (5) ideas into solutions. The problem (6) was that every (7) person wanted to start (8) work at the same time. He raised his hand (9) and said this might (10) be difficult.

He was an American (11) manager and wanted to show (12) his team that each part (13) of the project was important. They talked about (14) how to work against (15) delays. They looked for a place (16) quiet over (17) there. It was such (18) a busy schedule that they had to begin again (19) a few (20) times.

They hired a few (20) extra developers in case (21) the deadline was near. The most (22) important task each week (23) was to update the company (24) leaders about progress. Then they wondered where (25) the project‚Äôs system (26) would fail. Mr. Carter reminded each (27) member to do the right (28) thing.

They tested the program (29) until they could hear (30) feedback, so (31) they could improve. One question (32) came during (33) the demo about compatibility. Some thought the software would work (34) for education, others saw it as a way to play (35) games. The government (36) might use it too.

They needed to run (37) tests on a small (38) number (39) of devices. They turned it off (40) when a glitch appeared. They always (41) had to move (42) quickly to fix errors. It felt like (43) they were working at night (44), but they wanted to live (45) by their goals.

Mr (1) Carter made his point (46) clearly, and all team members believe (47) in him. He will hold (48) a meeting today (49) to bring (50) everyone together.

Evaluaci√≥n 5 Vocabulario Nivel B1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version): 5

Floods happen next without warning. People prepare before a large storm hits all towns. Over a million residents must leave home. Rising floods flow under doors bringing water into each room. To be ready, families write instructions. A mother keeps her kids in a safe area. The national authority gives money and help. This is not just one story. It affects the young too. The fact is that each month, weather can be different. People have a lot of steps to study. A book catches every eye with tips. Some find a job teaching safety. Every word in the guide matters, though some skip details. Local business owners solve each issue quietly. On the side, volunteers show kind acts. Four rescue teams use their head to scout far away. Dark black skies and a long siren signal danger. Both adults and children need a little practice. Each house must answer yes to drills. After training, they discuss lessons since the last drill. There is no task too long to provide readiness. Volunteers provide service around the clock. A friend coordinates the team. It is important to stay safe.

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version): 5

Floods happen (1) next (2) without (3) warning. People prepare before (4) a large (5) storm hits all (6) towns. Over a million (7) residents must (8) leave home (9). Rising floods flow under (10) doors bringing water (11) into each room (12). To be ready, families write (13) instructions. A mother (14) keeps her kids in a safe area (15). The national (16) authority gives money (17) and help. This is not just one story (18). It affects the young (19) too. The fact (20) is that each month (21), weather can be different (22). People have a lot (23) of steps to study (24). A book (25) catches every eye (26) with tips. Some find a job (27) teaching safety. Every word (28) in the guide matters, though (29) some skip details. Local business (30) owners solve each issue (31) quietly. On the side (32), volunteers show kind (33) acts. Four (34) rescue teams use their head (35) to scout far (36) away. Dark black (37) skies and a long (38) siren signal danger. Both (39) adults and children need a little (40) practice. Each house (41) must answer yes (42) to drills. After (43) training, they discuss lessons since (44) the last drill. There is no task too long (45) to provide (46) readiness. Volunteers provide (47) service (47) around (48) the clock. A friend (49) coordinates the team. It is important (50) to stay safe.

Evaluaci√≥n 6 Vocabulario Nivel B1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version): 6

Father told his son to sit quietly. The bench was away from the busy street until night. The power of silence was strong. After an hour, they saw a game group arrive. They often played outside, yet this match was special. A long line formed by the end of the match.

People stood among friends, and no one had ever felt so happy. They must stand even in bad weather, or they would lose the best seats. However, one member of the crowd asked for water. Fans would pay attention, for sports has its own law.

At nine o‚Äôclock, they meet at the car and drove to another city. Almost everyone arrived. Their plans include meals and a tour. They continue traveling even if traffic is slow. They set a time to leave later. The whole community was excited.

They had much to discuss. Each child says their name. There were five helpers once they arrived. A white banner read ‚ÄúWelcome.‚Äù At least three teachers were there. The president of the club wanted them to learn from experience. He said this was real teamwork.

They needed to change the schedule. The team practiced every minute to be the best. It took several tries to find the right idea. Every kid used their body to play well. The coach gave information about each role.

After that, there was nothing to worry about. An hour ago, they did not know the plan. Now the children can lead the game themselves.

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version): 6

Father (1) told his son to sit (2) quietly. The bench was away (3) from the busy street until (4) night. The power (5) of silence was strong. After an hour (6), they saw a game (7) group arrive. They often (8) played outside, yet (9) this match was special. A long line (10) formed by the end (11) of the match.

People stood among (12) friends, and no one had ever (13) felt so happy. They must stand (14) even in bad (15) weather, or they would lose (16) the best seats. However (17), one member (18) of the crowd asked for water. Fans would pay (19) attention, for sports has its own law (20).

At nine o‚Äôclock, they meet (21) at the car (22) and drove to another city (23). Almost (24) everyone arrived. Their plans include (25) meals and a tour. They continue (26) traveling even if traffic is slow. They set (27) a time to leave later (28). The whole community (29) was excited.

They had much (30) to discuss. Each child says their name (31). There were five (32) helpers once (33) they arrived. A white (34) banner read ‚ÄúWelcome.‚Äù At least (35) three teachers were there. The president (36) of the club wanted them to learn (37) from experience. He said this was real (38) teamwork.

They needed to change (39) the schedule. The team (40) practiced every minute (41) to be the best (42). It took several (43) tries to find the right idea (44). Every kid (45) used their body (46) to play well. The coach gave information (47) about each role.

After that, there was nothing (48) to worry about. An hour ago (49), they did not know the plan. Now the children can lead (50) the game themselves.

B1 Evaluaci√≥n Temas
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor? 2

Hace las preguntas para evaluar los temas que debe conocer en ese nivel como familia, info personal; aunque reconocemos que no se ha abarcado completamente.

Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante? 2

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel b√°sico

Preguntas para evaluar los temas
9. Travel and Transportation

  1. How do you usually get to work or school?

  2. What was your last trip like?

  3. Have you ever traveled by plane? Where did you go?

  4. What is your favorite way to travel? Why?

  5. Can you describe your dream vacation?

  6. Have you ever missed a train or a bus? What happened?

  7. What do you prefer: traveling alone or with friends? Why?

  8. How do you prepare for a long trip?

  9. What kind of transportation do you think is the fastest?

  10. Have you ever used a taxi or a ride-sharing app? How was it?

  11. What are some advantages of traveling by train?

  12. How do you feel when you travel to a new country?

  13. What do you like to do during a flight?

  14. Have you ever stayed in a hotel? What do you expect from a good hotel?

  15. Can you explain how to buy a ticket for a bus or train?

  16. What would you take with you on a trip?

  17. What places would you like to visit in your country?

  18. Do you think public transportation is safe in your city?

  19. How can someone save money while traveling?

  20. What are some problems people can have during traveling?

  21. Have you ever lost your luggage? What did you do?

  22. What do you think about traveling by bike or scooter in the city?

  23. How do you usually spend time at the airport?

  24. Can you describe a typical day during a holiday trip?

  25. What tips would you give to someone traveling to a foreign country for the first time?

10. Health and Body

  1. How often do you exercise?

  2. What do you do to stay healthy?

  3. Have you ever had a serious illness? How did you feel?

  4. What is your favorite healthy food?

  5. Can you describe your daily routine for taking care of your body?

  6. Have you ever been to a hospital? Why?

  7. What do you think about smoking and drinking alcohol?

  8. How do you usually relax after a stressful day?

  9. What are some common health problems people have today?

  10. How do you feel when you don‚Äôt get enough sleep?

  11. Can you explain why it is important to drink water?

  12. What should people do if they have a cold or flu?

  13. How often do you visit the doctor for a check-up?

  14. Do you prefer home remedies or medicine when you‚Äôre sick? Why?

  15. What advice would you give to someone who wants to lose weight?

  16. Can you describe a healthy lifestyle?

  17. Have you ever injured yourself while playing sports?

  18. What do you think about mental health? Is it important?

  19. How can someone stay motivated to exercise regularly?

  20. What is your favorite sport or physical activity?

  21. What foods should you avoid to stay healthy?

  22. How do you protect yourself from getting sick during winter?

  23. Can you explain what you should do in case of an emergency?

  24. What habits can harm your health?

  25. Have you ever had to take medicine for a long time? What was it for?

11. Feelings and Emotions

  1. How do you feel when you are happy?

  2. What makes you feel sad or upset?

  3. Can you describe a time when you were really angry?

  4. How do you usually express your emotions?

  5. What do you do when you feel nervous?

  6. Have you ever been scared of something? What was it?

  7. How do you comfort a friend who is sad?

  8. What are some things that make you feel excited?

  9. Can you explain the difference between being tired and being bored?

  10. How do you feel when you achieve a goal?

  11. What do you do to calm down when you are stressed?

  12. Can you describe how you feel on a typical weekend?

  13. Have you ever felt jealous? Why?

  14. What do you think about showing your emotions in public?

  15. How do you react when someone surprises you?

  16. What emotions do you feel when you listen to music?

  17. Have you ever felt disappointed? What happened?

  18. Can you explain why some people are shy?

  19. How do you handle feeling lonely?

  20. What makes you feel proud of yourself?

  21. How do you feel about making new friends?

  22. What do you think about crying? Is it a sign of weakness or strength?

  23. Have you ever been embarrassed? What happened?

  24. How can someone improve their mood quickly?

  25. What emotions do you associate with the seasons of the year?

12. Technology and Communication

  1. How often do you use the internet?

  2. What is your favorite social media platform? Why?

  3. Can you explain how to send an email?

  4. Have you ever bought something online? What was it?

  5. How do you usually communicate with your friends?

  6. Do you prefer texting or talking on the phone? Why?

  7. What are some advantages of using smartphones?

  8. What problems can technology cause in everyday life?

  9. How do you protect your personal information online?

  10. Can you describe your favorite app or website?

  11. How do you think technology will change in the future?

  12. Have you ever had problems with your computer or phone? What did you do?

  13. What do you think about online learning?

  14. How can technology help in your job or studies?

  15. Do you use video calls to talk to your family or friends?

  16. What are some rules for safe internet use?

  17. How much time do you spend on your phone daily?

  18. Have you ever learned something new using the internet?

  19. Can you explain how to download an app?

  20. What do you think about social media and mental health?

  21. How do you stay focused when there are many distractions online?

  22. What kind of technology do you use at home?

  23. Have you ever created a blog or a social media post? What was it about?

  24. How do you feel when your phone battery is low?

  25. What advice would you give to someone who wants to learn how to use a computer?

13. Entertainment

  1. What is your favorite type of music?

  2. Can you describe a movie you recently watched?

  3. What kind of books do you like to read?

  4. Do you prefer watching movies at home or in the cinema? Why?

  5. What TV shows do you like to watch?

  6. Have you ever been to a concert? How was it?

  7. What do you do when you are bored?

  8. Can you talk about your favorite actor or actress?

  9. What kind of games do you like to play?

  10. Do you prefer watching sports or playing sports? Why?

  11. What is the last song you listened to?

  12. How do you usually spend your weekends?

  13. What do you think makes a good movie or book?

  14. Have you ever met a famous person? What happened?

  15. Can you explain how to play your favorite game?

  16. What hobbies do you have in your free time?

  17. What entertainment do you enjoy with your family?

  18. How often do you go to the theater or concerts?

  19. What is a popular festival or event in your country?

  20. Can you describe a funny or interesting story you remember?

  21. What is the best way to relax after work or school?

  22. How do you feel about reality TV shows?

  23. Have you ever tried a new hobby recently? What was it?

  24. What do you like about cartoons or animated movies?

  25. Can you recommend a good movie or book?

14. Sports and Activities

  1. What sports do you like to watch or play?

  2. How often do you exercise or play sports?

  3. Can you describe your favorite sport?

  4. Have you ever played a team sport? Which one?

  5. What equipment do you need for your favorite sport?

  6. What is the most popular sport in your country?

  7. Can you explain the rules of a sport you like?

  8. How do you feel after doing physical activity?

  9. What sports did you play when you were a child?

  10. Have you ever been to a sports event? What was it like?

  11. What is more important: skill or fitness? Why?

  12. Can you describe a memorable game or match you watched?

  13. What do you think about extreme sports?

  14. Have you ever tried yoga or meditation? How was the experience?

  15. What are some benefits of doing sports regularly?

  16. How do you stay motivated to keep active?

  17. Can you explain how to warm up before exercising?

  18. What sports do you like to do outdoors?

  19. How do sports help people make friends?

  20. Have you ever been injured while doing sports? What happened?

  21. What is your opinion about professional athletes?

  22. What activities do you do when the weather is bad?

  23. Can you describe a sport you would like to learn?

  24. What are some sports that are popular in your city?

  25. How do you prepare for a sports competition or event?

  1. Opci√≥n 1: El profesor coloca un audio de reductores de ruido y el estudiante dice qu√© dijo el audio y lo traduce al espa√±ol. (El estudiante dice: She‚Äôs tall - Ella es alta)

Frase en ingl√©s

Tiempo Verbo Clave

Pasado

Pasado

They decided to go to the park.

Ellos decidieron ir al parque.

Estos ni√±os estaban jugando y riendo.

Ellos la estaban pasando muy bien.

Debes creer en ti mismo/a

Necesitas controlarte

Sol√≠a jugar f√∫tbol cuando era m√°s joven

Ella sol√≠a vivir en Par√≠s antes de mudarse aqu√≠

We used to go camping every summer

Sol√≠amos ir de camping todos los veranos

He used to work as a teacher before becoming a doctor

√âl sol√≠a trabajar como profesor antes de convertirse en m√©dico

They used to have a dog but it passed away

Ellos sol√≠an tener un perro pero muri√≥

used to

Would you like some coffee or tea?

¬øTe gustar√≠a caf√© o t√©?

Reductor Adverbs with and without have

Frase en ingl√©s

Traducci√≥n al espa√±ol

Tema

Ella siempre ha recordado el cumplea√±os de su abuela

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

She always remembers to lock the door

Ella siempre recuerda cerrar la puerta con llave

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

They have never visited that museum before

Nunca han visitado ese museo antes

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

They never eat fast food on weekdays

Nunca comen comida r√°pida entre semana

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

We have often discussed this problem at work

Hemos discutido este problema en el trabajo a menudo

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

We often go to the cinema on Fridays

A menudo vamos al cine los viernes

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

He has sometimes forgotten to call his parents

A veces se ha olvidado de llamar a sus padres

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

He sometimes forgets his keys at home

A veces se olvida las llaves en casa

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

I have usually finished my homework by dinner time

Normalmente he terminado mis deberes para la hora de cenar

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

I usually wake up at seven in the morning

Normalmente me despierto a las siete de la ma√±ana

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

Has entendido completamente la lecci√≥n hoy

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

Te olvidaste completamente de la reuni√≥n ayer

Si lloviera ma√±ana, el picnic ser√≠a cancelado

Si realmente nos esforz√°ramos m√°s, seguramente tendr√≠amos √©xito

Reductor Should Have+Must have

Frase en ingl√©s

Traducci√≥n al espa√±ol

Tema

Ella deber√≠a haber llamado a su madre ayer

√âl deber√≠a haber estudiado m√°s para el examen

Tom deber√≠a haber llegado temprano a la oficina

Deber√≠as haberme contado sobre la reuni√≥n

Deber√≠amos haber comprado los boletos con anticipaci√≥n

Other pronouns - Should have sentences

Ellos deber√≠an haber terminado su tarea para ahora

Other pronouns - Should have sentences

Ella debe haber olvidado sus llaves en casa

3rd person of the singular - Must have sentences

David debe haber tomado el autob√∫s equivocado hoy

3rd person of the singular - Must have sentences

The teacher must have explained this lesson before

El profesor debe haber explicado esta lecci√≥n antes

3rd person of the singular - Must have sentences

Debes haber visto la pel√≠cula ya

Other pronouns - Must have sentences

Debemos haber caminado por dos horas ya

Ellos deben haber escuchado las noticias ayer

Other pronouns - Must have sentences

She always arrives at work on time

Ella siempre llega al trabajo a tiempo

You never listen to my advice

Nunca escuchas mis consejos

√âl a menudo visita a su abuela los fines de semana

A veces vamos al cine juntos

Other pronouns - Adverb: sometimes

Lisa usualmente desayuna a las siete

Other pronouns --- Enough after adjectives

Estoy lo suficientemente cansado/a para acostarme temprano

Soy lo suficientemente valiente para probar el restaurante nuevo

Ella es lo suficientemente alta para alcanzar el estante superior

√âl es lo suficientemente inteligente para resolver este problema

Hace lo suficientemente calor para ir a nadar hoy

B1 Evaluaci√≥n Comprensi√≥n
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor? 4

Va a evaluar las estructuras que debe manejar en ese nivel como tiempos y verbos.

Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante? 4

Debe poder comprender cualquiera de las siguientes lecturas

Lecturas a Evaluar
Lectura 1 Comprensi√≥n Nivel B1

1. My Family
I have a close relationship with my family. Although we are all busy, we always make time for each other. My older sister is studying at university, and my younger brother is still in high school. We like to play board games or go for walks together when we can.

2. My House
I live in an apartment in the city center. It‚Äôs convenient because everything is nearby, like shops and my school. My apartment has three bedrooms, a kitchen, and a small balcony. I enjoy sitting on the balcony in the evening and watching the sunset.

3. My Best Friend
My best friend, Alex, is someone I trust a lot. We‚Äôve known each other since childhood, and we share many memories. He‚Äôs good at solving problems and always gives me advice. When I feel stressed, Alex knows how to cheer me up.

Lectura 2 Comprensi√≥n Nivel B1

4. My Favorite Food
I enjoy trying new dishes, but my favorite food will always be sushi. I like the combination of fresh fish and rice. I also love desserts, especially chocolate cake. When I go to restaurants, I usually try to order something different every time.

5. A Day at School
School can be both fun and challenging. I enjoy learning new things, especially in science and literature. My teachers are helpful, and I often ask questions during class. After school, I sometimes stay to practice with the drama club, which is one of my favorite activities.

6. My Hobbies
My hobbies keep me busy and help me relax. I love writing short stories because it allows me to express my ideas. I also enjoy hiking in the mountains. Photography is another hobby I‚Äôve started recently, and I‚Äôm learning how to take better pictures.

7. The Weather
Weather can affect my mood a lot. When it‚Äôs sunny, I feel more energetic and motivated. However, on rainy days, I prefer staying indoors and reading a good book. Winter is not my favorite season because it‚Äôs too cold, but I love the snow.

Lectura 3 Comprensi√≥n Nivel B1

pinky is between a rock and a hard place his owner wants to kick him out of the house. Just this morning, he got in trouble. When his owner was at the supermarket buying some things for lunch, pinky sat on the table. Beside him, on the table, there was tuna so pinky ate it. Then he saw a pot in front of him, so he jumped and fell inside the pot that had fish soup in it. The pot wasn‚Äôt hot yet. His owner had left the pot on low heat for safety while she was at the supermarket. pinky ate so much that he fell asleep inside the pot. When his owner came home, she put the pot on the high heat and started looking for pinky, but he was well hidden‚Äîhe was inside the pot. After a few minutes, his owner heard the pot moving violently. Could it be that a fish was alive? pinky‚Äôs owner uncovered the pot, and something furry shot out. It was pinky, who was terrified and hid under the table. His owner tried to get him out from under the table with a broom, but pinky climbed up her face and hid behind the stove in front of the fridge. However, he was too near the hot pot, so hid beside the cold fridge. When his owner was gonna reach him he jumped, went outside, and scrambled up a tree. pinky is still outside in the tree. He doesn't want to come down, but he is very hungry, so he‚Äôs still between a rock and a hard place.

Lectura 4 Comprensi√≥n Nivel B1

Sarah is happy today. She was sad yesterday, but has been feeling better since this morning. Sarah has a new hobby. She had tried many before, but had never found the right one. She does puzzles now. She did one yesterday and has done three this week. Sarah goes to the park often. She went there last weekend and has gone there every day this week. She gets excited about nature. She got a new plant yesterday and has gotten interested in gardening. Sarah makes time for her hobbies. She made a schedule last month and has made good progress. She takes photos of her plants. She took a beautiful picture yesterday and has taken many since then. Her friend comes to visit sometimes. He came last week and has come twice this month. They see each other regularly. They saw a movie together recently and have seen many interesting plants in the park.

Lectura 5 Comprensi√≥n Nivel B1

Max brings his camera everywhere. He brought it to the beach last summer and has brought it on every trip since. He builds confidence in his photography skills daily. He built a small studio at home last year and has built quite a portfolio. Max buys photography books often. He bought a new lens last month and has bought several accessories this year. He chooses his subjects carefully. He chose to focus on nature photography last spring and has chosen to explore urban landscapes recently.

Max drinks coffee while editing photos. He drank three cups during an all-night editing session and has drunk more green tea lately for health reasons. He drives to scenic locations for shoots. He drove to the mountains last weekend and has driven thousands of miles for his art. Max eats healthy to stay energized. He ate a big breakfast before a dawn shoot yesterday and has eaten more vegetables since starting his fitness routine.

Sometimes, Max falls asleep editing late at night. He fell asleep at his desk last week and has fallen into the habit of setting alarms. He never forgets his camera. He forgot extra batteries once last year but has forgotten nothing since that lesson. Max's skills grow constantly. His talent grew noticeably last year, and he has grown into a respected photographer in his community.

B1 Evaluaci√≥n Speaking
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor? 5

Hace las preguntas para evaluar su capacidad de comunicarse y hablar en ingl√©s

Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante? 5

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel b√°sico

Preguntas para evaluar el speaking
üó£ Personal Information

  1. What do you do for a living?

  2. Can you describe your daily routine?

  3. What are your hobbies and interests?

  4. How do you usually spend your weekends?

  5. Can you describe your best friend?

  6. What are your strengths and weaknesses?

  7. What kind of music do you like?

  8. What do you usually do in your free time?

  9. Can you tell me about your hometown?

  10. What languages do you speak?

üß≥ Travel and Holidays

  1. Have you ever traveled abroad? Where?

  2. What‚Äôs your dream travel destination?

  3. How do you usually prepare for a trip?

  4. Do you prefer the beach or the mountains? Why?

  5. What‚Äôs the best vacation you‚Äôve ever had?

üçù Food and Drink

  1. What‚Äôs your favorite food or meal?

  2. Can you cook? What dishes can you make?

  3. What did you eat for breakfast today?

  4. Do you prefer eating out or at home?

  5. Is there a traditional dish from your country you recommend?

üìö Education and Learning

  1. What subjects did you like most in school?

  2. How do you prefer to learn new things?

  3. Have you ever taken an online course?

  4. What‚Äôs the most useful thing you‚Äôve learned this year?

  5. Why are you learning English?

üíº Work and Career

  1. What‚Äôs your ideal job?

  2. Do you enjoy working in a team or alone?

  3. Have you ever had a part-time job?

  4. What skills are important for your job?

  5. What are your professional goals for the next five years?

üè† Home and Daily Life

  1. Can you describe your home?

  2. Do you live alone or with others?

  3. What chores do you usually do at home?

  4. What would you change about your neighborhood?

  5. What‚Äôs your morning routine like?

üß† Opinions and Preferences

  1. What do you think about social media?

  2. Do you prefer watching movies or reading books? Why?

  3. What do you think makes a good friend?

  4. Are you a morning person or a night owl?

  5. What do you think about working from home?

üåç Society and Culture

  1. What‚Äôs a typical celebration in your country?

  2. How is your culture different from others you know?

  3. What‚Äôs a local tradition you enjoy?

  4. What do you usually do on public holidays?

  5. Do you think it‚Äôs important to learn about other cultures?

ü©∫ Health and Lifestyle

  1. How do you stay healthy?

  2. Do you do any sports or physical activities?

  3. What do you do when you feel stressed?

  4. How often do you go to the doctor?

  5. What habits would you like to improve?

B1 Evaluaci√≥n Herramientas
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor? 6
  • Asegurarse de que todos los estudiantes tienen las actividades de este nivel realizadas para poder ser aprobados en esta evaluaci√≥n.
  • El profesor hace una evaluaci√≥n del ANKI de cada estudiante tal y como se hace en las clases en vivo regulares; la diferencia radica en que el profesor eval√∫a (sin previo aviso) diferentes contenidos al mismo estudiante en la misma clase
Actividades a realizar
  1. Audios Diarios: 74 publicaciones subidas
  2. Actividades de la plataforma: 33 publicaciones subidas
  3. Tests: 14 tests aprobados subidas
Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante? 6
  • Plataforma y herramientas: Conocer todo el contenido del ANKI.
  • Herramienta de reducci√≥n de ruido: Que pueda entender cualquier audio de reducci√≥n de ruido
Reducci√≥n de Ruido a Evaluar (Las mismas del nivel)

Reductor Preposiciones y Acciones despu√©s de la lecci√≥n Preposiciones

Frase en ingl√©s

Traducci√≥n al espa√±ol

Are the kids playing outside?

¬øEst√°n los ni√±os jugando afuera?

Yes, they are playing outside.

S√≠, est√°n jugando fuera.

Are your keys at home?

¬øEst√°n tus llaves en casa?

No, they are not at home.

No, no est√°n en casa.

Was he behind the door?

¬øEstaba √©l detr√°s de la puerta?

Yes, he was behind the door.

S√≠, estaba detr√°s de la puerta.

Is the cat on the table?

¬øEst√° el gato sobre la mesa?

Yes, it is on the table.

S√≠, est√° sobre la mesa.

Is the ball under the chair?

¬øEst√° la pelota debajo de la silla?

Yes, it is under the chair.

S√≠, est√° debajo de la silla.

Is the park near your house?

¬øEst√° el parque cerca de tu casa?

Yes, it is near my house.

S√≠, est√° cerca de mi casa.

Is the store between the banks?

¬øEst√° la tienda entre los bancos?

Yes, it is between them.

S√≠, est√° entre ellos.

Is your phone inside the drawer?

¬øEst√° tu celular dentro del caj√≥n?

Yes, it is inside the drawer.

S√≠, est√° dentro del caj√≥n.

Is the car in front of the house?

¬øEst√° el carro frente a la casa?

Yes, it is in front of the house.

S√≠, est√° frente a la casa.

Is she sitting beside you?

¬øEst√° ella sentada a tu lado?

Yes, she is sitting beside me.

S√≠, est√° sentada a mi lado.

¬øD√≥nde est√° el libro?

Est√° en la bolsa.

Reductor Acciones 4

Frase en ingl√©s

Traducci√≥n al espa√±ol

Tipo de oraci√≥n

Tiempo

Verbo Clave

Did you hear the noise?

¬øEscuchaste el ruido?

Pregunta Positiva

Pasado simple

Frase en ingl√©s

Tema

No puede tener m√°s de 25 a√±os; se ve muy joven.

¬øTe gustar√≠a caf√© o t√©?

Ella siempre ayudaba a sus vecinos cuando lo necesitaban

¬øTe importar√≠a cerrar la ventana, por favor?

√âl dijo que me llamar√≠a m√°s tarde esta noche

Would

Reductor Adverbs with and without have

Frase en ingl√©s

Traducci√≥n al espa√±ol

Tema

She has always remembered her grandmother's birthday

Ella siempre ha recordado el cumplea√±os de su abuela

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

She always remembers to lock the door

Ella siempre recuerda cerrar la puerta con llave

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

They have never visited that museum before

Nunca han visitado ese museo antes

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

They never eat fast food on weekdays

Nunca comen comida r√°pida entre semana

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

We have often discussed this problem at work

Hemos discutido este problema en el trabajo a menudo

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

We often go to the cinema on Fridays

A menudo vamos al cine los viernes

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

He has sometimes forgotten to call his parents

A veces se ha olvidado de llamar a sus padres

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

He sometimes forgets his keys at home

A veces se olvida las llaves en casa

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

I have usually finished my homework by dinner time

Normalmente he terminado mis deberes para la hora de cenar

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

I usually wake up at seven in the morning

Normalmente me despierto a las siete de la ma√±ana

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

Has entendido completamente la lecci√≥n hoy

Orden correcto de adverbios con have

Te olvidaste completamente de la reuni√≥n ayer

Orden correcto de adverbios sin have

Reductor If Clauses

Frase en ingl√©s

Traducci√≥n al espa√±ol

Tema

Si ella estudiara m√°s, aprobar√≠a el examen

Si √©l viviera en Par√≠s, hablar√≠a franc√©s con fluidez

Si lloviera ma√±ana, el picnic ser√≠a cancelado

Traducci√≥n al espa√±ol

Ella deber√≠a haber llamado a su madre ayer

El profesor debe haber explicado esta lecci√≥n antes

Debemos haber caminado por dos horas ya

Ellos deben haber escuchado las noticias ayer

Ella siempre llega al trabajo a tiempo

Nunca escuchas mis consejos

A veces vamos al cine juntos

Notas Generales
Objetivo

Lograr que los estudiantes pasen con √©xito todas las habilidades y demuestren que tienen los conocimientos necesarios que se requieren para ser certificados como un hablante de ingl√©s en nivel A1

¬øHasta d√≥nde se evalua en esta prueba?

Esta semana se estudia desde el m√≥dulo AQU√ç INICIAS EL NIVEL A2 hasta el m√≥dulo Semana 18: A2 TESTS PARA APROBAR EL NIVEL A2

Notas profesor

Saludos
